definition: arising involuntarily (idiom); spontaneous/to spring up unbidden (of emotion)
oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: I feel tired of all these things which makes me even more sleepless.
sentences.chinese: 一種厭倦感油然而生，使身體更加抗拒睡眠的到來。

sentences.english: Compassion rose up in my heart when I saw the beggar drop dead in the street.
sentences.chinese: 當我看到這個乞丐倒斃街頭時，憐憫之心油然而生。

sentences.english: Vacations help us regain that sense of spontaneity and self-expression.
sentences.chinese: 假期有助我們重獲油然而生的感覺和自我表達的感覺。

sentences.english: And this brilliant film will enlist your sympathies, too.
sentences.chinese: 而這部優秀的電影也會讓你的同情油然而生。

sentences.english: I looked up to check, feeling off-balance .
sentences.chinese: 我擡起頭去核對，一種挫敗感油然而生。

sentences.english: Maybe there's a sense of superiority for conquering the craving?
sentences.chinese: 也許，一股征服自我的優越感油然而生？

sentences.english: He squinted at the girl, love rising in his heart.
sentences.chinese: 他斜着眼睛看着那個姑娘，愛慕油然而生。

sentences.english: Qing Fu hand with delicate pieces of trim, felt a sense of satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 用手輕撫着細膩的內飾件，一種滿足感油然而生。

sentences.english: Venus, the planet that rules your fifth house of true loves, will be in a playful, spontaneous mood.
sentences.chinese: 主宰你真愛宮的金星將會帶來油然而生的輕鬆心態。

sentences.english: Venus, the pl that rules your fifth house of true loves, will be in a playful, spontaneous mood.
sentences.chinese: 主宰真宮的太白星將會帶來油然而生的輕鬆心態。

definition: to have guts/to have courage/to be brave
lit. sth hits one in the face/directly in one's face/sth assaults the senses/blatant (advertising)/eye-catching/(a smell) assaults the nostrils
to give birth/to grow (whiskers etc)/to generate/to produce
to feel even more/to be extremely (sad, lonely, delighted etc)
to feel deep veneration for sb (idiom)
